Pre-Game Insights: Denver heads into a matchup against San Antonio as winners of three games in a row.
The Nuggets average 31.7 assists per game to lead the Western Conference, paced by Nikola Jokic with 9.7.
The Spurs have a 3-3 record in games decided by 3 points or fewer.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets are 12-9 in Western Conference games.
The Spurs are 14-13 in Western Conference play.
Jamal Murray is scoring 19.8 points per game and averaging 4.1 rebounds for the Nuggets.
Victor Wembanyama is averaging 25.6 points, 10 rebounds, 3.9 assists and 3.9 blocks for the Spurs.
The Nuggets average 11.7 made 3-pointers per game this season, 1.5 fewer makes per game than the Spurs give up (13.2).
The Spurs are shooting 45.7% from the field, 1.3% lower than the 47.0% the Nuggets' opponents have shot this season.
The Nuggets are 7-3 in their last 10 games, averaging 126.3 points, 45.9 rebounds, 33.5 assists, 8.8 steals and 4.0 blocks per game while shooting 52.5% from the field.
The Spurs are 6-4 in their last 10 games, averaging 112.6 points, 46.6 rebounds, 30.3 assists, 7.3 steals and 8.3 blocks per game while shooting 46.4% from the field.
Others: Aaron Gordon is day to day with a calf injury for the Nuggets.
DaRon Holmes II is out for the season with an achilles injury for the Nuggets.
Vlatko Cancar is out with a knee injury for the Nuggets.
Jeremy Sochan is day to day with a back injury for the Spurs.
